description:
When you're the infamous prodigy hitman known only as “Fable,” many things come easy. Being a normal person, however, isn't one of them. In fact, being told that he can't kill anyone for a while may just be the hardest job Fable’s ever taken...

(Source: Kodansha USA)

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Acrobatics
tags.description: The art of jumping, tumbling, and balancing. Often paired with trapeze, trampolining, tightropes, or general gymnastics.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayama11)

Married to [Atsuko Ueno](https://anilist.co/staff/216671/).

Older brother of [Kenji Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/105419/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋良輔_(アニメ監督%29)

Originally from [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/). He is one of [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most influential figures, pioneering and evolving the "real robot" genre of anime with shows such as [Taiyou no Kiba Dougram](https://anilist.co/anime/2257/) and [Soukou Kihei Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/).

After graduating from junior high school, he went through many jobs such as working at a plumber and a woodworking factory, and in 1999, debuted as a cartoonist with the 41st Chiba Tetsuya prize semi-award in Naniwa Tomoare.

He has experience as in japanese "ring tribes", and wrote manga based on that experience. He used to drive a Sprinter Trueno (AE92 type), Corolla Levin (AE86 type), Sylvia (S13 type) . In particular, the S13 Silvia is a model of the main character's favorite car in Naniwa Tomoare.

**Genres:** Hip-hop, Funk, Jazz

__[Website](https://alienlibertyinternational.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ALI_MUSIC_DANCE)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnYvfe8YHnRRly5SCA8mP5A)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2Qqrew4ZcEwf9NY7UqWGfU)__

__Introduction:__
ALI, otherwise known as Alien Liberty International, is a multinational hip-hop/funk band led by vocalist [Reo Imamura](https://anilist.co/staff/158752/Reo-Imamura), otherwise known as Leo. The band has its roots all over earth, from Japan to Europe, the United States to Asia, Africa and other countries.

Their first single *"Wild Side"* was chosen as the opening theme to the anime [*BEASTARS*](https://anilist.co/anime/107660). A year later, their second single *"Lost in Paradise"* featuring rapper [AKLO](https://anilist.co/staff/191499/) was chosen as the ending theme to the anime [*Jujutsu Kaisen*](https://anilist.co/anime/113415).

The band announced an indefinite hiatus on May 14, 2021 following the arrest and indictment of member Kahadio. They also announced his contract termination from the band the same day.  As a result, the band was dropped from performing the opening theme *"Teenage City Riot"* for the anime [*Subarashiki Kono Sekai The Animation*](https://anilist.co/anime/120376) before it began airing. Half a year later on Nov 18, following their indefinite hiatus, the band announced they would resume activities.

__Members:__
- [Reo Imamura](https://anilist.co/staff/158752/Reo-Imamura) (今村怜央), better known as Leo – leader, vocalist
- [Luthfi Kusuma](https://anilist.co/staff/158776/Luthfi) (楠間ルッフィ), better known as Luthfi – bassist
- [Alexander Taiyou Fidel](https://anilist.co/staff/158775/Alex) (アレクサンダー・タイヨウ・フィデル), better known as Alex – percussionist
- [Aiichirou Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/192971) (田中愛一朗), better known as Cesar – guitarist

__Former Members:__
- [Jua](https://anilist.co/staff/158751/Jua) – rapper
- [Zeru](https://anilist.co/staff/158774/Zeru) – guitarist
- [Kadio Shirai](https://anilist.co/staff/158772/Kahadio) (白井カディオ), better known as Kahadio – drummer
- [Yuu Hagiwara](https://anilist.co/staff/158777/Yu) (萩原優), better known as Yuu/Yu – saxist
- [Jin Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/158773/Jin) (井上仁), better known as Jin – keyboardist/pianist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/umeda_cypher) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/CodaHTiSd0d) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRJL3BrWVc-ypwXSBprk-1g) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@umeda_cypher) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2yx4K2BgLQjIPPT1IodR6Y)

__Introduction:__
Umeda Cypher is a Japanese hip-hop group that consists of various rappers, MCs, DJs and music producers. The group originates from cyphers that were held at the Osaka and Umeda stations alongside its participants. 

The first meet dates back to May 19, 2007, when one of the original members Funk said he wanted to rap more, so he and two of the other original members H.YOROZU and akiramen plus other participants orchestrated a cypher every saturday night at the pedestrian bridge connecting the Hanshin Department Store and Hankyu Department Store in Umeda.

__Members:__
- KBD (古武道) – rapper
- peko – rapper
- KZ – rapper
- KennyDoes (ケニーダズ), alternatively known as Doiken (ドイケン) – rapper
- [R-Shitei](https://anilist.co/staff/207162/RShitei) (R-指定) – rapper
- KOPERU (コペル) – rapper
- TAKE-M (テークエム) – rapper
- teppei – rapper
- HATCH (ハチ) – rapper
- Cosaqu (コーサク) – rapper, DJ, producer
- ILL SWAG GAGA – rapper
- DJ SPI-K – DJ
- Cola (コーラ) – rapper
- Tamakou (たまこう), alternatively known as Kousuke Tamai (タマイコウスケ) – rapper
- AO – rapper
- MCRIBBON (MCりぼん) – rapper
- Lard (ラード) – rapper
- Rei (レイ) – rapper
- PEPPEBOMB (ペッペBOMB) – rapper

__Former Members:__
- OSCA, alternatively known as Yoshihiro Komatsu (コマツヨシヒロ) – rapper
- tella, alternatively known as GeckoTribe – rapper
- Taurin (たうりん) – rapper
- Funk (ふぁんく) – rapper
- akiramen (あきらめん) – rapper
- H.YOROZU – rapper
A prolific freelance animator known for working on a large number of shows at any given time.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/杉野昭夫) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akio_Sugino)

A veteran animator with a career spanning over 50 years.

Noted for his work on shows like [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2402/), [Ace wo Nerae!](https://anilist.co/anime/311/), [Nobody's Boy: Remi](https://anilist.co/anime/2828/) and [Treasure Island](https://anilist.co/anime/2618/).

Yoshida graduated from Osaka Designers' College, where he studied under [Moriyasu Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/106638/) and joined his studio [Anime R](https://anilist.co/studio/971/Anime-R) thereafter. He also acts as a lecturer at Amusement Media Academy and is a member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).
